title: Electricity production graph - recent coal decline

content.question: Which of the following is the most valid inference regarding electricity production, based on the graph above?

choices.label: Electricity production from coal began to decrease in 2008 because of shortages in coal supplies.
Electricity production from coal began to decrease in 2008 because of the increasing use of natural gas and renewable energy.
The use of nuclear energy increased from 1970 to 2010 because of the low cost of constructing nuclear power plants.
The use of nuclear energy increased from 1970 to 2010 because of shortages in coal supplies.
Renewable energy has not increased as much as nuclear energy has since 1970 because of federal laws restricting construction of wind farms.

content.answer: Electricity production from coal began to decrease in 2008 because of the increasing use of natural gas and renewable energy.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Describe patterns or trends in data.
